I‚Äôll never stop fighting for Upstate NY and standing up to big corporations is what I was sent to Washington to do.
These are commonsense solutions that can make an improvement in the day-to-day lives for our seniors and working families.
I voted to stop drug companies from gaming the system and delaying more affordable medicine from coming to the market.
I voted to make it easier for generic drugs to hit the market, increase competition, and lower prices.

Folks in Upstate NY are seeing drugs that have been on the market for decades rising in price. Some are worried they may have to choose between the medicine they need and putting food on their tables.

While drug company profits continue to rise, I hear from Upstate New Yorkers who struggle to afford the life-saving prescription drugs they need.
